text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits revised IRM 1.1.28, Organization and Staffing, Return Preparer Office.
The following changes were made in this section:

) The Return Preparer Office is responsible for matters relating to the tion, renewal and compliance of return preparers who prepare tax returns compensation. Responsibilities include but are not limited to: • Issuing and renewing Preparer Tax Identiﬁcation Numbers (PTINs), • Managing the enrolled practitioner program, • Administering the Annual Filing Season Program, • Making suitability determinations, • Processing complaints against return preparers, • Ensuring programmatic compliance by return preparers, • Coordinating with other business units regarding identiﬁed ance, and • Researching the effectiveness of return preparer treatments on compliance. (
) The Return Preparer’s Office’s mission is to improve taxpayer compliance ensuring minimum standards for tax professionals and providing them ongoing support. (
) The Return Preparer Office’s vision is to foster a community of practitioners working with the IRS to improve tax administration (

) The Return Preparer Office is comprised of an Office of the Director and following eight departments: • Strategy and Finance • Vendor Processes and Business Requirements • Communications • Competency and Standards • Compliance • Return Preparer Suitability • Enrolled Agent Policy and Management • Joint Board for the Enrollment of Actuaries (
) Register and promote a qualiﬁed tax professional community. (
) Improve the compliance and accuracy of tax returns prepared by paid preparers.

The Return Preparer Office is responsible for matters relating to the registra- tion, renewal and compliance of return preparers who prepare tax returns for compensation. Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

Issuing and renewing Preparer Tax Identiﬁcation Numbers (PTINs), Managing the enrolled practitioner program, Administering the Annual Filing Season Program, Making suitability determinations, Processing complaints against return preparers, Ensuring programmatic compliance by return preparers, Coordinating with other business units regarding identiﬁed ance, and Researching the effectiveness of return preparer treatments on compliance.
The Return Preparer Office’s vision is to foster a community of professional tax practitioners working with the IRS to improve tax administration
Vendor Processes and Business Communications Competency and Standards Compliance Return Preparer Suitability Enrolled Agent Policy and Management Joint Board for the Enrollment of Actuaries
1.1.28.2 (10-16-2017) Return Preparer Office Strategic Goals
The Return Preparer Office maintains an updated Continuity Plan to ensure its operations are performed efficiently with minimal disruption.
Organization and
rd successor: Director, Return Preparer Office, Vendor Processes Business Requirements (
) The mission of the Office of the Director is to provide executive strategic direction and policy oversight to the Return Preparer Office ments. (

) The Director of the Return Preparer Office reports to the Deputy Commis- sioner, Services and Enforcement. The Deputy Director of the Return Office reports to the Director, Return Preparer Office. The Director and Director are responsible for: a. Supervising and coordinating Return Preparer Office activities in dance with its strategic goals. b. Establishing operational policies for the Return Preparer Office. c. Supporting the departments in deﬁning and delivering current responsibilities; engaging and developing personnel; and ensuring spective program planning. d. Strengthening partnerships with the tax professional community and stakeholders to ensure effective tax administration. e. Identifying potential risks that could impact the Return Preparer and developing mitigation plans. (
) The mission of the Strategy and Finance department is to develop and the Return Preparer Office staffing plan, manage its funding model and budgets, and administer its policies and procedures. (

) The Director, Strategy and Finance, reports to the Director, Return Office, and is responsible for: a. Strategic planning. b. Budgeting. c. Financial forecasting. d. Organizing spending plans. e. Providing and coordinating training. f. Supporting personnel and labor relations. g. Measuring departmental and operational performance. h. Responding to external auditors. i. Responding to requests under the Freedom of Information Act. j. Resolving issues identiﬁed via Commissioner and Congressional corre- spondence. k. Performing quality and operational reviews. (

) The mission of the Vendor Processes and Business Requirements is to provide oversight of all Return Preparer Office activities outsourced to third-party vendors, manage the office’s information technology needs, security, and provide contract management oversight through the Officer Representatives. (

) The Director, Vendor Processes and Business Requirements, reports to Director, Return Preparer Office, and is responsible for: a. Administering PTIN registration and renewal program, and the Filing Season Program. Internal Revenue Manual Cat. No.

b. Overseeing third-party vendor contracts. c. Developing and maintaining systems used by the Return Preparer including Enterprise Life Cycle (ELC) activities and Section

ance. d. Planning and managing business systems requirements. e. Overseeing the Return Preparer Office‘s Case Management f. Overseeing the Return Preparer Office’s Business Systems Planning program. g. Overseeing the Return Preparer Office’s Risk Management activities. (

) The mission of the Communications department is to develop, oversee, implement all Return Preparer Office communications in a strategic ensuring that internal and external stakeholders understand the of the return preparer program. (

) The Director, Communications, reports to the Director, Return Preparer and is responsible for: a. Drafting and reviewing news releases and other outreach messaging. b. Monitoring and maintaining all internal and external web pages the Return Preparer Office. c. Maintaining the Return Preparer Office social networking sites. d. Reviewing all Return Preparer Office correspondence. e. Managing external stakeholder interactions. f. Developing and drafting various communications for the Director, as needed. (

) The mission of the Competency and Standards department is to provide program oversight and guidance for the development and administration of both the Enrolled Agent - Special Enrollment Exam and the Continuing Education program. (

) The Director, Competency and Standards, reports to the Director, Return Preparer Office, and is responsible for: a. Managing the Special Enrollment Exam and Continuing Education provider system vendor relationships and contracts. b. Overseeing development and administration of the Enrolled Agent Special Enrollment Examination. c. Overseeing the Continuing Education provider application approval renewal processes, including completing compliance reviews for new established Continuing Education programs and facilitating the quality continuing education. d. Developing the Annual Federal Tax Refresher course outline and test rameters for the Annual Filing Season Program, processing Annual Season Program appeals, and conducting reviews of Annual Federal Refresher courses offered by Continuing Education providers. e. Maintaining regular communication and collaboration with Enrolled - Special Enrollment Exam candidates and the Continuing Education provider community regarding program developments and related

Maintaining the Return Preparer Office social networking sites. Reviewing all Return Preparer Office correspondence. Managing external stakeholder interactions. Developing and drafting various communications for the Director, as needed.
1.1.28.4.4 (05-21-2021) Competency and Standards

Managing the Special Enrollment Exam and Continuing Education provider system vendor relationships and contracts. Overseeing development and administration of the Enrolled Agent Special Enrollment Examination. Overseeing the Continuing Education provider application approval and renewal processes, including completing compliance reviews for new and established Continuing Education programs and facilitating the delivery of quality continuing education. Developing the Annual Federal Tax Refresher course outline and test pa

rameters for the Annual Filing Season Program, processing Annual Filing Season Program appeals, and conducting reviews of Annual Federal Tax Refresher courses offered by Continuing Education providers. Maintaining regular communication and collaboration with Enrolled Agent
Special Enrollment Exam candidates and the Continuing Education provider community regarding program developments and related issues.

) The mission of the Compliance department is to address return preparer program and PTIN noncompliance, and process complaints involving sated return preparers. Compliance identiﬁes and develops treatments and referral criteria for varying types of return preparer noncompliance. (

) The Director, Compliance, reports to the Director, Return Preparer Office, is responsible for: a. Evaluating and treating program noncompliance. b. Identifying and treating questionable preparers. c. Detecting and treating ghost preparers. d. Developing referrals to other IRS business units. e. Evaluating and processing complaints against return preparers. f. Supporting return preparer programs in other IRS business units. (

) The mission of the Suitability department is to perform suitability checks and determine program eligibility of certain individuals who apply for a Preparer Preparer Identiﬁcation Number (PTIN) or for enrollment to practice before the IRS. (

) The Director, Return Preparer Suitability, reports to the Director, Return Preparer Office, and is responsible for: a. Conducting personal tax compliance checks. b. Reviewing reported professional designations. c. Conducting criminal background checks. d. Ensuring prisoner compliance. e. Performing the review of Specially Designated Nationals. f. Evaluate individual return preparers referred for a suitability check. (
) The mission of the Enrolled Agent Policy and Management department is to provide oversight, management and subject matter expertise for the enrolled Agent Policy practitioner program. (

) The Director, Enrolled Agent Policy and Management, reports to the Director, Return Preparer Office, and is responsible for: a. Processing applications and renewals for Enrolled Agents and for Enrolled Retirement Plan Agents. b. Supporting and maintaining toll-free telephone service for practitioners. c. Establishing, revising and maintaining currency of documents and dures in support of PTIN registration, renewal and call center (

) The mission of the Joint Board for the Enrollment of Actuaries department is provide administrative and legal support to the Joint Board for the Board for the of Actuaries, which is responsible for establishing reasonable standards and of Actuaries qualiﬁcations for persons performing actuarial services for plans subject to Employee Retirement Income Security Act of
) The Executive Director, Joint Board for the Enrollment of Actuaries, reports the Director, Return Preparer Office, and is responsible for:
1.1.28.4.6 (05-21-2021) Return Preparer Suitability

The mission of the Joint Board for the Enrollment of Actuaries department is to provide administrative and legal support to the Joint Board for the Enrollment of Actuaries, which is responsible for establishing reasonable standards and qualiﬁcations for persons performing actuarial services for plans subject to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of
The Executive Director, Joint Board for the Enrollment of Actuaries, reports to the Director, Return Preparer Office, and is responsible for:

Ensuring procedures and systems are in place to timely process new plications and renewals of Enrolled Actuaries and recognizing organizations approved as a Qualifying Sponsor of Continuing credit. Maintaining records for Enrolled Actuaries and Qualifying Sponsors. Conducting random audits of Enrolled Actuary Continuing Education tax compliance records as well as Qualifying Sponsor programs to ensure compliance with the Joint Board regulations. Providing administrative support to the Joint Board’s Advisory on Actuarial Examinations, which is responsible for preparing the three enrollment examinations administered by the Joint Board. Ensuring that the Advisory Committee on Actuarial Examinations complies with the Federal Advisory Committee Act. Monitoring the conduct of Enrolled Actuaries and initiating disciplinary cases before an administrative law judge when necessary.
